history.proof: intros H. destruct l. - contradiction. - exists 0. shelve.

exceptions.exn: In environment b : bool l : list bool H : b :: l <> nil Unable to unify "iter list_bool_next (Zero :: nil) 0" with "b :: l".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
l: list bool

Goal:
l <> nil -> {n : nat | l = iter list_bool_next (Zero :: nil) n}

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
list_bool_next = let list_bool_next_def := fun l : list bool => let s := list_bool_choose_sym l in match s with | inl (existT _ k (exist _ tl H)) => eq_rec_r (fun l0 : list bool => {m : list bool | list_bool_succ l0 m}) (exist (fun m : list bool => list_bool_succ (list_repeat One k ++ Zero :: tl) m) (list_repeat Zero k ++ One :: tl) (in_lbs_0 k tl)) H | inr (exist _ k H) => eq_rec_r (fun l0 : list bool => {m : list bool | list_bool_succ l0 m}) (exist (fun m : list bool => list_bool_succ (list_repeat One k) m) (list_repeat Zero (S k)) (in_lbs_1 k)) H end in fun l : list bool => proj1_sig (list_bool_next_def l) : list bool -> list bool Arguments list_bool_next _%list_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
iter : forall X : Type, (X -> X) -> X -> nat -> X
Notation Zero := false
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
iter_list_bool_next_nil : forall (l : list bool) (n : nat), iter list_bool_next l n = nil -> n = 0 /\ l = nil
list_bool_next_neq_nil : forall l : list bool, list_bool_next l <> nil
Wf_Z.Z_of_nat_complete_inf : forall x : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 x -> {n : nat | x = BinInt.Z.of_nat n}
app_removelast_last : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (d : A), l <> nil -> l = removelast l ++ last l d :: nil
exists_last : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), l <> nil -> {l' : list A & {a : A | l = l' ++ a :: nil}}
list_max_lt : forall (l : list nat) (n : nat), l <> nil -> list_max l < n < -> Forall (fun k : nat => k < n) l
Relation_Operators.Desc_sind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> SProp), P nil -> (forall x : A, P (x :: nil)) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> P (l ++ y :: nil) -> P ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)) -> forall l : list A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA l -> P l
Relation_Operators.Desc_ind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall x : A, P (x :: nil)) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> P (l ++ y :: nil) -> P ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)) -> forall l : list A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA l -> P l
Nat.eq_dec : forall n m : nat, {n = m} + {n <> m}
le_lt_dec : forall n m : nat, {n <= m} + {m < n}
nat_list_insert = fix nat_list_insert (x : nat) (l : list nat) {struct l} : list nat := match l with | nil => x :: nil | y :: l0 => if x <? y then x :: y :: l0 else if y <? x then y :: nat_list_insert x l0 else y :: l0 end : nat -> list nat -> list nat Arguments nat_list_insert _%nat_scope _%list_scope
list_bool_succ_nil : forall l : list bool, list_bool_succ nil l -> l = Zero :: nil
Inductive Permutation (A : Type) : list A -> list A -> Prop := perm_nil : nil ~p nil | perm_skip : forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' -> x :: l ~p x :: l' | perm_swap : forall (x y : A) (l : list A), y :: x :: l ~p x :: y :: l | perm_trans : forall l l' l'' : list A, l ~p l' -> l' ~p l'' -> l ~p l'' Arguments Permutation.Permutation [A]%type_scope (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Permutation.perm_nil _%type_scope Arguments Permutation.perm_skip [A]%type_scope _ [l l']%list_scope Arguments Permutation.perm_swap [A]%type_scope _ _ _%list_scope Arguments Permutation.perm_trans [A]%type_scope [l l' l'']%list_scope
map_last : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (a : A), map f (l ++ a :: nil) = map f l ++ f a :: nil
Permutation.Permutation_length_2_inv : forall (A : Type) (a1 a2 : A) (l : list A), a1 :: a2 :: nil ~p l -> l = a1 :: a2 :: nil \/ l = a2 :: a1 :: nil
O_or_S : forall n : nat, {m : nat | S m = n} + {0 = n}
list_bool_succ_neq : forall l m : list bool, list_bool_succ l m -> l <> m
list_bool_nat = fix list_bool_nat (l : list bool) : nat := match l with | nil => 1 | One :: l0 => 1 + 2 * list_bool_nat l0 | Zero :: l0 => 0 + 2 * list_bool_nat l0 end : list bool -> nat Arguments list_bool_nat _%list_scope
Permutation.Permutation_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), P nil nil -> (forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (x :: l')) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), P (y :: x :: l) (x :: y :: l)) -> (forall l l' l'' : list A, l ~p l' -> P l l' -> l' ~p l'' -> P l' l'' -> P l l'') -> forall l l0 : list A, l ~p l0 -> P l l0
Permutation.Permutation_length_1_inv : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (l : list A), a :: nil ~p l -> l = a :: nil
flat_map_single : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (l : list X), flat_map (fun x : X => f x :: nil) l = map f l
Inductive Desc (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) : list A -> Prop := d_nil : Relation_Operators.Desc A leA nil | d_one : forall x : A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (x :: nil) | d_conc : forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil) Arguments Relation_Operators.Desc _%type_scope _%function_scope _%list_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.d_nil _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.d_one _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.d_conc _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _ _%list_scope
removelast_app : forall (A : Type) (l l' : list A), l' <> nil -> removelast (l ++ l') = l ++ removelast l'
ltl_unit : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (x : list A) (a b : A), Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (x ++ a :: nil) -> Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA (x ++ a :: nil) (b :: nil) -> Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA x (b :: nil)
list_upper_bound : forall l : list nat, {m : nat | forall x : nat, In x l -> x < m}
min_dec : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, {P n} + {~ P n}) -> (exists n : nat, P n) -> {m : nat | P m /\ (forall x : nat, P x -> m <= x)}
first_which : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, {P n} + {~ P n}) -> (exists x : nat, P x) -> {m : nat | P m /\ (forall x : nat, x < m -> ~ P x)}
rev_unit : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (a : A), rev (l ++ a :: nil) = a :: rev l
seq = fix seq (start len : nat) {struct len} : list nat := match len with | 0 => nil | S len0 => start :: seq (S start) len0 end : nat -> nat -> list nat Arguments seq (_ _)%nat_scope
Relation_Operators.d_conc : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)
removelast_last : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (a : A), removelast (l ++ a :: nil) = l
list_max = fun l : list nat => fold_right Init.Nat.max 0 l : list nat -> nat Arguments list_max _%list_scope
list_bool_succ_rect : forall P : list bool -> Type, P nil -> (forall l m : list bool, list_bool_succ l m -> P l -> P m) -> forall l : list bool, P l
Permutation.Permutation_nil : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), nil ~p l -> l = nil
incl_l_nil : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), incl l nil -> l = nil
map_eq_nil : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A), map f l = nil -> l = nil
list_eq_dec : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> forall l l' : list A, {l = l'} + {l <> l'}
list_nat_bool = fix list_nat_bool (ln : list nat) : list bool := match ln with | nil => nil | x :: ll => list_repeat Zero x ++ One :: list_nat_bool ll end : list nat -> list bool Arguments list_nat_bool _%list_scope
app_eq_nil : forall (A : Type) (l l' : list A), l ++ l' = nil -> l = nil /\ l' = nil
list_app_head_not_nil : forall (X : Type) (u v : list X), u <> nil -> v <> u ++ v
